availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City & County of New York SS

I Edwin F Corey of the City County and State of New York, having been duly Comissioned in pursuance to the Laws of Kentucky a Comissioner of Deeds in and for the State of New York, with power to take the acknowledgments and proof of deeds and other instruments in writing to administer oaths and take depositions to be recorded or used in said State of Kentucky.
Do solemnly Swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of said office according to the Laws of the State of Kentucky
Subscribed and Sworn to before me this 8th day of day of June A D 1863

Edwin F. Corey Jun
Commissioner for Kentucky in New York

figure.ab:
EDWIN F. COREY JR.
FOR
KENTUCKY
COMMISSIONER

stamp.note:
E. F. C. Jr.

JUN 9 1863

body.p:
New York
Oath
Comr of Deeds
Ed. F. Corey
Filed June 12 1863
